title: Linux cut Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the versatile Linux cut command and learn how to extract specific columns from text files. Discover practical examples to enhance your text processing skills.

meta.title: Linux cut Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the versatile Linux cut command and learn how to extract specific columns from text files. Discover practical examples to enhance your text processing skills.
meta.keywords: Linux, cut command, text processing, data extraction, column manipulation, text editing

steps.title: Understand the cut Command Syntax and Options

verify.name: Verify the cut command syntax and options
verify.hint: Make sure you understand the syntax and options of the `cut` command, including how to extract fields and characters from a text file.

steps.title: Extract Specific Columns from a Text File

verify.name: Verify column extraction
verify.hint: Make sure you can use the `cut` command to extract specific columns from a CSV-like data file. Try different column ranges and delimiters.

steps.title: Use cut Command with Pipe to Process Data

verify.name: Verify using cut with pipe
verify.hint: Make sure you can use the `cut` command in combination with other commands like `cat`, `grep`, and `awk` to process data from various sources.
